intro: Sidalcea nervata, commonly known as the narrowleaf checker-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and have prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. Sidalcea nervata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
